{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following muscles is not attached laterally to the thyroid cartilage, we need to review the information provided in the relevant documents. According to Document [2], the oblique line of the thyroid cartilage serves as a site of attachment for several muscles, including the sternothyroid, thyrohyoid, and inferior constrictor. Document [4] specifically states that the thyrohyoid muscle extends from the oblique line of the thyroid cartilage to the hyoid bone superiorly. Document [5] states that the sternothyroid muscle extends from the oblique line of the thyroid cartilage to the sternum. However, there is no mention of the superior constrictor muscle in the provided documents. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Superior constrictor.", "answer_choice": "C"}
